content.description: Start under the roof at the left end of a good rail. Make your way right until the roof ends at a small arete. Swing over onto the face and top out via good horizontals. Mega-classic for the area and a bit stiffer than its neighbouring V3's, making a test piece for the grade.
content.protection: One pad and a spotter to move it. There is a couple of janky rocks at the start.
content.location: The obvious king (or queen) line of this boulder. This thing just wants to be climbed.

content.description: Makes a great warm-up for other problems on this bloc. Stand start on a good edge and go up. Classic!
content.location: On the right side of the boulder where the rock goes directly into the ground. Obvious horizontal seams and edges on a nearly vertical face, capped by a very small roof.

content.description: Start on the fin undercling and head straight up on good holds.
content.location: On east side of the boulder (opposite from the Women King roof side) under the overhanging prow.

content.description: SDS on the jug to the left of a tree. Climb up and slightly left to an enjoyable topout.
content.location: On the right side of the Woman king bloc. Start on a large flat jug the is just to the left of a tree.

content.description: Start left on the big rail under the prow as for Woman King. Traverse right to the center of the roof and make a reachy move to the lip just right of the tree. Finish as for Death to America on good juggy holds. Crux is not dabbing on the tree.
content.location: Under the main prow of Woman King.

content.description: Stand start on the rail to the right of the tree over Woman King. Proceed to bump right, either campusing or trying to keep your toes on Woman kings rail. Heel hook and make few more hand bums until you can mantel onto the bloc.
content.protection: Single Pad and a spotter. Good landing.
content.location: Starts to the right of the tree that is growing into the roof over Woman King.

content.description: High quality bloc featuring 14 problems from V0 to V10. Notably its namesake "Woman King" (V3) and "Thin Mints" (V1), area and region classics.
